module.p: ro before, in front of is the (leniting) antessive preposition.

section.p:
The default form of the antessive preposition is simply ro –
ro thaigh before a house
ro aislingean before dreams
ro Nirribhidh before Norway
ro thrì làithean before three days

When the immediately following word is a singular form of the definite article, the linking form ron is used –
ron an taigh before the house, rather than ro an taigh
ron a’ bhaile before the town, rather than ro a’ bhaile But –
ro na h-aislingean before the dreams, rather than ron na h-aislingean
Note that ron an and ron a’ often reduce to just ron – ron taigh, ron bhaile.

Fused forms are sometimes found when the immediately following word is a possessive determiner –
ro mo thaigh before my house ≈ rom thaigh
ro do bhaile before your town ≈ rod bhaile
ro a h-òran before her song ≈ ro h-òran
ro a chraoibh before his tree ≈ ro chraoibh
ro ar n-achadh before our field ≈ rar n-achadh
ro ur leapannan before your beds ≈ rur leapannan
ro an taighean before their houses ≈ ron taighean
ro am baile before their town ≈ rom baile
Note that these fused forms are rather awkward and sometimes ambiguous and hence are best avoided in writing nowadays.

Conjugated prepositions are used in place of ro mi, ro thu, ... , ro iad –
romham before me
romhad before you
roimhpe before her/it
roimhe before him/it
romhainn before us
romhaibh before you
romhpa before them

There are also emphatic forms (cf. ro mise, ro thusa, ... , ro iadsan) –
romhamsa before me
romhadsa before you
roimhpese before her/it
roimhesan before him/it
romhainne before us
romhaibhse before you
romhpasan before them
Note that the form roimhesan breaks the ‘slender-to-slender, broad-to-broad’ spelling rule, and hence is sometimes found written with a hyphen – roimhe-san.

Finally, there are also reflexive forms (cf. ro mi fhìn, ro thu fhèin, ... , ro iad fhèin) –
romham fhìn before myself
romhad fhèin before yourself
roimhpe fhèin before herself/itself
roimhe fhèin before himself/itself
romhainn fhìn before ourselves
romhaibh fhèin before yourselves
romhpa fhèin before themselves

module.p:
Corpus examples –
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn. [...] Cha b’ fhuilear do dhuine de ’n t-seòrsa so tomhas mhath de chumhachd a bhith aige. Cha dean math dha a bhith air a shlaodadh aig tòin Coimitidh, ach feumaidh an Coimitidh earbsa a bhith aca ás. Bhiodh sin aca nan cuireadh e obair romhpa, agus nan tugadh e gu buil gach obair air an tugadh iad làmh.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General who will oversee the Society’s work. [...] A person of this kind would have to have a good measure of power. It would do him no good to be dragged along by the Committee ??, but the Committee must have trust in him. They would have that if he would put work before them ??, and if he would complete every job which they would get a hold of ??. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
